required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Extended Access Program With Lorcaserin For The Treatment of Dravet Syndrome and Other Refractory Epilepsies
clinical_study.official_title: Extended Access Program and Retrospective Chart Review for Lorcaserin in Dravet Syndrome and Other Refractory Epilepsies

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to provide continued access of lorcaserin to participants with Dravet syndrome and other refractory epilepsies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Confirmed diagnosis of Dravet syndrome (according to Recommendation from a North American Consensus Panel, 2017) or other refractory epilepsy (per the judgment of the treating physician)
2. Male or female, age at least 2 years at the time of informed consent
3. Currently treated with lorcaserin, that the treatment is for Dravet syndrome or other refractory epilepsies, and the treatment was initiated before 13 Feb 2020; or has completed Study E2023-A001-304
4. Has a clinical benefit from lorcaserin in the opinion of the treating physician
Exclusion Criteria:
None
